intro: Paraselliguea leucophora, commonly known as the white-leaved paraselliguea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
